sources.title: Riders of Destiny
sources.description: John Wayne portrays Singin' Sandy Saunders and has a reputation as the most notorious gunman since Billy the Kid. That's somewhat ironic though, since it's later revealed that he's a special Secret Service agent sent from Washington to investigate a land swindle scheme under the direction of town boss James Kincaid (Forrest Taylor).

sources.title: Riders of Destiny (1933), with John Wayne as a singing cowboy
sources.channelName: Public Domain Movies - Classic Old Movies

sources.title: Riders of Destiny (1933)
sources.description: James Kincaid controls the local water supply and plans to do away with the other ranchers. Government agent Sandy Saunders arrives undercover to investigate Kincaid's land swindle scheme, and win the heart of one of his victims, Fay Denton. metadata.Plot: Kincade controls the area's water supply and is about to force the ranchers into contracts at exorbitant rates. Government Agent Saunders has a plan that will open up the lost river and dry up Kincade's supply. So he gets the ranchers to insist on a clause that Kincade's land will revert to the public if he fails to deliver water.
metadata.Actors: John Wayne, Cecilia Parker, Forrest Taylor
